translated: And that which is its cause,

original: tatpratyayaṃ kāyasya bhedād ākāśānantyāyatanānāṃ devānāṃ sabhāgatāyām upapadyate /
analyzed: tad pratyayam kāyasya bhedāt ākāśa anantya āyatanānām devānām sabhā gatāyām upapadyate
translated: due to the dissolution of the body, he is reborn in the company of the gods of the sphere of infinite space.

original: tatra yā jātiḥ saṃjātir vistareṇa yāvaj jīvitendriyaprādurbhāva /🔽itīyaṃ jātir imaṃ bhavaṃ pratītya tad ucyate DhskD
analyzed: tatra yā jātiḥ saṃjātiḥ vistareṇa yāvat jīvita indriya prādurbhāva  iti iyam jātiḥ imam bhavam pratītya tat ucyate
translated: There, birth, being born, in detail up to the appearance of the life faculty,🔽this birth is dependent on this becoming, therefore it is said:

original: bhavapratyayā jātir iti /
analyzed: bhava pratyayā jātiḥ iti
translated: Birth has becoming as its condition.

original: yathā khalv ihaikatyo vijñānānantyāyatanānāṃ devānām avekṣāvān bhavati pratibaddhacittaḥ /
analyzed: yathā khalu iha ekatyaḥ vijñāna anantya āyatanānām devānām avekṣāvān bhavati pratibaddha cittaḥ
translated: For example, here someone is intent on and attached to the gods of the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: tasyaivaṃ bhavaty /
analyzed: tasya evam bhavati
translated: He thinks like this:

original: aho batāhaṃ vijñānānantyāyatanānāṃ devānāṃ sabhāgatāyām upapadyeyaṃ DhskD iti /
analyzed: aho bata aham vijñāna anantya āyatanānām devānām sabhā gatāyām upapadyeyam dhskd  iti
translated: Oh, may I be reborn in the company of the gods of the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: sa tatprārthayamānas taddhetos tatsaṃvartanīyaṃ sarvaśa ākāśānantyāyatanaṃ samatikramyānantaṃ vijñānam iti vijñānānantyāyatanam upasaṃpadya viharati /
analyzed: sa tat prārthayamānaḥ tad hetoḥ tat saṃvartanīyam sarvaśas ākāśa ānantya āyatanam samatikramya anantam vijñānam iti vijñāna ānantya āyatanam upasaṃpadya viharati
translated: Desiring that, for that reason, for that cause, completely transcending the sphere of infinite space, thinking consciousness is infinite, he attains and dwells in the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: tathā samāpannasya yā cetanā yāvac cittābhisaṃskāro DhskD
analyzed: tathā samāpannasya yā cetanā yāvat citta abhisaṃskāraḥ
translated: For one who has attained it thus, whatever volition there is, up to whatever mental formation there is,

original: manaskarmāyam ucyate kuśalaḥ karmabhavaḥ /
analyzed: manaskarmā ayam ucyate kuśalaḥ karma bhavaḥ
translated: this is said to be wholesome action-existence.

original: yad api taddhetu tatpratyayaṃ kāyasya bhedād vijñānānantyāyatanānāṃ devānāṃ sabhāgatāyām upapadyate /🔽tatra yā jātiḥ saṃjātiḥ vistareṇa DhskD
analyzed: yat api tad hetu tad pratyayam kāyasya bhedāt vijñāna anantya āyatanānām devānām sabhā gatāyām upapadyate  tatra yā jātiḥ saṃjātiḥ vistareṇa
translated: And also, due to that cause and that condition, after the dissolution of the body, he is reborn in the company of the gods of the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: yāvaj jīvitendriyasya prādurbhāva /
analyzed: yāvat jīvita indriyasya prādurbhāva
translated: There, whatever birth, rebirth, in detail, up to the appearance of the life faculty,

original: itīyaṃ jātir imaṃ bhavaṃ pratītya tad ucyate bhavapratyayā jātir iti /
analyzed: iti iyam jātiḥ imam bhavam pratītya tat ucyate bhava pratyayā jātiḥ iti
translated: this birth depends on this existence. Therefore it is said: With existence as condition, birth.

original: yathā khalv ihaikatya ākiṃcanyāyatanānāṃ devānām avekṣāvān bhavati pratibaddhacittaḥ DhskD /
analyzed: yathā khalu iha ekatyaḥ ākiṃcanya āyatanānām devānām avekṣāvān bhavati pratibaddha cittaḥ dhskd
translated: For example, here someone is intent on the gods of the sphere of nothingness, his mind is attached.

original: tasyaivaṃ bhavaty /
analyzed: tasya evam bhavati
translated: He thinks like this:

original: aho batāham ākiṃcanyāyatanānāṃ devānāṃ sabhāgatāyām upapadyeyam iti /🔽sa tatprārthayamānas taddhetos tatsaṃvartanīyaṃ sarvaśo vijñānānantyāyatanaṃ samatikramya nāsti DhskD
analyzed: aho bata aham ākiṃcanya āyatanānām devānām sabhā gatāyām upapadyeyam iti  sa tat prārthayamānaḥ tad hetoḥ tat saṃvartanīyam sarvaśas vijñāna ānantya āyatanam samatikramya na asti dhskd
translated: Oh, may I be reborn in the company of the gods of the sphere of nothingness.

original: kiṃ cid ity ākiṃcanyāyatanam upasaṃpadya viharati /
analyzed: kim cit iti ākiṃcanya āyatanam upasaṃpadya viharati
translated: Desiring that, for that reason, for that cause, having completely transcended the sphere of infinite consciousness, thinking there is nothing at all, he attains and dwells in the sphere of nothingness.

original: tathā samāpannasya yā cetanā saṃcetanā vistareṇa yāvac cittābhisaṃskāro manaskarma ayam ucyate kuśalaḥ karmabhavaḥ /
analyzed: tathā samāpannasya yā cetanā saṃcetanā vistareṇa yāvat citta abhisaṃskāraḥ manaskarma ayam ucyate kuśalaḥ karma bhavaḥ
translated: For one who has attained it thus, whatever volition, intention, in detail up to mental activity, mental action, this is called wholesome becoming.

original: DhskD yad api taddhetu tatpratyayaṃ kāyasya bhedād ākiṃcanyāyatanānāṃ devānāṃ sabhāgatāyāṃ upapadyate /
analyzed: yat api tad hetu tad pratyayam kāyasya bhedāt ākiṃcanya āyatanānām devānām sabhā gatāyām upapadyate
translated: And whatever, for that reason, for that cause, after the dissolution of the body, he is reborn in the company of the gods of the sphere of nothingness,

original: tatra yā jātiḥ saṃjātiḥ vistareṇa yāvaj jīvitendriyasya prādurbhāva DhskD /
analyzed: tatra yā jātiḥ saṃjātiḥ vistareṇa yāvat jīvitendriyasya prādurbhāva
translated: there whatever birth, being born, in detail up to the appearance of the life faculty,

original: itīyaṃ jātir imaṃ bhavaṃ pratītya tad ucyate bhavapratyayā jātir iti /
analyzed: iti iyam jātiḥ imam bhavam pratītya tat ucyate bhava pratyayā jātiḥ iti
translated: this birth is said to depend on this becoming. Therefore it is said: With becoming as condition, birth.

original: yathā khalv ihaikatyo naivasaṃjñānāsaṃjñāyatanānāṃ devānām avekṣāvān bhavati pratibaddhacittaḥ /
analyzed: yathā khalu iha ekatyaḥ na eva saṃjñā na asaṃjñā āyatanānām devānām avekṣāvān bhavati pratibaddha cittaḥ
translated: Just as here someone is intent on and attached to the gods of the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.

original: DhskD tasyaivaṃ bhavaty /
analyzed: tasya evam bhavati
translated: For him it occurs in this way:

original: aho batāhaṃ naivasaṃjñānāsaṃjñāyatanānāṃ devānāṃ sabhāgatāyāṃ upapadyeyam iti /
analyzed: aho bata aham na eva saṃjñā na asaṃjñāyatanānām devānām sabhā gatāyām upapadyeyam iti
translated: Oh, may I be reborn in the company of the gods of the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.

original: sa tatprārthayamānas taddhetos tatsaṃvartanīyaṃ ākiṃcanyāyatanaṃ samatikramya DhskD
analyzed: sa tat prārthayamānaḥ tad hetoḥ tat saṃvartanīyam ākiṃcanya āyatanam samatikramya
translated: Desiring that, for that reason, having transcended the sphere of nothingness,

original: naivasaṃjñānāsaṃjñāyatanam upasaṃpadya viharati /
analyzed: na eva saṃjñā na asaṃjñā āyatanam upasaṃpadya viharati
translated: he attains and abides in the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.

original: tathā samāpannasya yā cetanā vistareṇa yāvac cittābhisaṃskāro manaskarmāyam ucyate kuśalaḥ karmabhavaḥ /🔽yad api taddhetu tatpratyayaṃ naivasaṃjñānāsaṃjñāyatanānāṃ DhskD
analyzed: tathā samāpannasya yā cetanā vistareṇa yāvat citta abhisaṃskāraḥ manaḥ karmā ayam ucyate kuśalaḥ karma bhavaḥ  yat api tad hetu tad pratyayam na eva saṃjñā na asaṃjñā āyatanānām
translated: For one who has attained it thus, the volition, in detail up to the mental formation, the mental action, this is called wholesome action-existence.

original: devānāṃ sabhāgatāyāṃ upapadyate /
analyzed: devānām sabhā gatāyām upapadyate
translated: And also that which, having that as its cause and that as its condition, is reborn in the company of the gods of the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception,

original: tatra yā jātiḥ saṃjātir avakrāntir abhinirvṛttiḥ prādurbhāvaḥ skandhapratilābho dhātupratilābhaḥ āyatanapratilābhaḥ jīvitendriyasya prādurbhāvaḥ DhskD /
analyzed: tatra yā jātiḥ saṃjātiḥ avakrāntiḥ abhinirvṛttiḥ prādurbhāvaḥ skandha pratilābhaḥ dhātu pratilābhaḥ āyatana pratilābhaḥ jīvita indriyasya prādurbhāvaḥ
translated: therein, the birth, being born, descent, manifestation, appearance, acquisition of aggregates, acquisition of elements, acquisition of sense bases, manifestation of the life faculty,

original: itīyaṃ jātir imaṃ bhavaṃ pratītya tad ucyate bhavapratyayā jātir iti /
analyzed: iti iyam jātiḥ imam bhavam pratītya tat ucyate bhava pratyayā jātiḥ iti
translated: This is called birth having this existence as its condition.

original: api khalv evam uktam bhagavatā mahānidānaparyāye vyākaraṇe āyuṣmaty ānande /
analyzed: api khalu evam uktam bhagavatā mahānidāna paryāye vyākaraṇe āyuṣmati ānande
translated: Moreover, this was said by the Blessed One in the Mahānidāna-vyākaraṇa Sūtra to the venerable Ānanda:

original: asti pratyayam ānanda jātir /
analyzed: asti pratyayam ānanda jātiḥ
translated: Ānanda, is there a condition for birth?

original: iti pṛṣṭair astīti DhskD vacanīyaṃ /
analyzed: iti pṛṣṭaiḥ asti iti dhskd  vacanīyam
translated: If asked this, one should say There is.

original: kiṃpratyayā jātir iti /
analyzed: kiṃpratyayā jātiḥ iti
translated: What is the condition for birth?

original: bhavapratyayā iti vacanīyaṃ /
analyzed: bhava pratyayāḥ iti vacanīyam
translated: One should say Existence.

original: bhavapratyayā ānanda jātir /
analyzed: bhava pratyayā ānanda jātiḥ
translated: Ānanda, birth has existence as its condition.

original: iti me yad uktam idaṃ me tat pratyuktaṃ /
analyzed: iti me yat uktam idam me tat pratyuktam
translated: This is what I said, and this is the answer to that.

original: bhavaś ced ānanda na syād api nu matsyānāṃ matsyatve pakṣiṇānāṃ vā pakṣitve DhskD
analyzed: bhavaḥ ced ānanda na syāt api nu matsyānām matsya tve pakṣiṇānām vā pakṣi tve
translated: Ānanda, if there were no existence, would there be any fish for the fish, or birds for the birds,

original: sarīsṛpāṇāṃ sarīsṛpatve catuṣpadānāṃ vā catuṣpadatve nāgānāṃ vā nāgatve yakṣāṇāṃ
analyzed: sarīsṛpāṇām sarīsṛpa tve catuṣpadānām vā catuṣpada tve nāgānām vā nāga tve yakṣāṇām
translated: or reptiles for the reptiles, or quadrupeds for the quadrupeds, or nāgas for the nāgas,

original: vā yakṣatve bhūtānāṃ vā bhūtatve gandharvāṇāṃ vā gandharvatve devānāṃ vā devatve
analyzed: vā yakṣa tve bhūtānām vā bhūta tve gandharvāṇām vā gandharva tve devānām vā deva tve
translated: or yakṣas for the yakṣas, or bhūtas for the bhūtas, or gandharvas for the gandharvas, or devas for the devas,

original: manuṣyāṇāṃ vā manuṣyatve DhskD
analyzed: manuṣyāṇām vā manuṣya tve dhskd
translated: or humans for the humans?🔽No, Blessed One.

original: teṣāṃ teṣām ānanda satvānāṃ tasmin tasmin satvanikāye api nu kasya cit kaś cid bhavaḥ syān /
analyzed: teṣām teṣām ānanda satvānām tasmin tasmin satva nikāye api nu kasya cit kaḥ cit bhavaḥ syān
translated: Ānanda, for those beings in that group of beings, would there be any existence for anyone?

original: no bhadanta /
analyzed: no bhadanta
translated: No, Venerable Sir.

original: sarvaśo vā punar ānanda bhave asaty api nu kasya cit kā cij jātiḥ prajñāyeta /
analyzed: sarvaśas vā punar ānanda bhave asati api nu kasya cit kā cit jātiḥ prajñāyeta
translated: Or, Ānanda, if there were absolutely no existence at all, would the birth of anyone be discerned?

original: no bhadanta /
analyzed: no bhadanta
translated: No, Venerable Sir.

original: DhskD tasmāt tarhy ānandaitan nidānam eṣa samudaya eṣa hetur eṣa pratyayo jātyā yad uta bhavaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi ānanda etat nidānam eṣa samudayaḥ eṣa hetuḥ eṣa pratyayaḥ jātyāḥ yat uta bhavaḥ
translated: Therefore, Ānanda, this is the source, this is the origin, this is the cause, this is the condition for birth, namely, existence.

original: bhavapratyayā ānanda jātir /
analyzed: bhava pratyayā ānanda jātiḥ
translated: Ānanda, birth has existence as its condition.

original: iti me yad uktam idaṃ me tat pratyuktaṃ /
analyzed: iti me yat uktam idam me tat pratyuktam
translated: What I said is answered by this.

original: jātipratyayā jarāmaraṇaśokaparidevaduḥkhadaurmanasyopāyāsāḥ
analyzed: jāti pratyayāḥ jarā maraṇa śoka parideva duḥkha daurmanasya upāyāsāḥ
translated: Aging, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, grief, and despair have birth as their condition.

original: jātipratyayaṃ jarāmaraṇam iti /
analyzed: jāti pratyayam jarā maraṇam iti
translated: Aging and death have birth as their condition.

original: jarā katamā /
analyzed: jarā katamā
translated: What is aging?

original: DhskD āha /
analyzed: āha
translated: He said:

original: yat teṣāṃ teṣāṃ satvānāṃ tasmiṃ tasmiṃ satvanikāye jātiḥ saṃjātir avakrāntir abhinirvṛttir vistareṇa jīvitendriyasya prādurbhāvaḥ iyam ucyate jātiḥ /
analyzed: yat teṣām teṣām satvānām tasmin tasmin satva nikāye jātiḥ saṃjātiḥ avakrāntiḥ abhinirvṛttiḥ vistareṇa jīvita indriyasya prādurbhāvaḥ iyam ucyate jātiḥ
translated: The birth, rebirth, descent into the womb, manifestation of the aggregates, manifestation of the sense bases, and manifestation of the life faculty of those beings in that group of beings is called birth.

original: api khalv evam uktaṃ bhagavatā mahānidānaparyāye DhskD
analyzed: api khalu evam uktam bhagavatā mahānidānaparyāye
translated: Moreover, it was said by the Blessed One in the Mahānidāna-parivarta:

original: vyākaraṇe āyuṣmaty ānande /
analyzed: vyākaraṇe āyuṣmati ānande
translated: In the discourse to the venerable Ānanda.

original: asti pratyayam ānanda jarāmaraṇaṃ /
analyzed: asti pratyayam ānanda jarā maraṇam
translated: Ānanda, is there a condition for old age and death?

original: iti pṛṣṭair astīti syād vacanīyaṃ /
analyzed: iti pṛṣṭaiḥ asti iti syāt vacanīyam
translated: If asked this, one should say There is.

original: vistareṇa yāvaj /🔽jātiś ced ānanda na syād api nu matsyānāṃ vā matsyatve pakṣināṃ vā DhskD
analyzed: vistareṇa yāvat  jātiḥ ced ānanda na syāt api nu matsyānām vā matsya tve pakṣinām vā
translated: In detail, up to:

original: pakṣitve vistareṇa yāvad devānāṃ devatve teṣāṃ teṣām ānanda satvānāṃ tasmiṃ tasmin satvanikāye api nu kasya cit kā cij jātiḥ syān /
analyzed: pakṣi tve vistareṇa yāvat devānām deva tve teṣām teṣām ānanda satvānām tasmin tasmin satva nikāye api nu kasya cit kā cit jātiḥ syān
translated: Ānanda, if there were no birth at all, in any way, of beings into any of the various orders of beings, namely, of beings born from eggs, from wombs, from moisture, or spontaneously; of beings with no feet, with two feet, with four feet, or with many feet; of beings with form or formless, with perception, without perception, or neither with nor without perception - would the manifestation of old age and death be discerned?

original: no bhadanta /🔽sarvaśo vā punar ānanda jātyām asatyāṃ DhskD
analyzed: no bhadanta  sarvaśas vā punar ānanda jātyām asatyām
translated: No, Venerable Sir.

original: api nu jarāmaraṇaṃ prajnāyeta /
analyzed: api nu jarā maraṇam prajnāyeta
translated: Ānanda, if there were absolutely no birth at all, in any way, of beings into any of the various orders of beings, would old age and death be discerned?

original: no bhadanta /
analyzed: no bhadanta
translated: No, Venerable Sir.

original: tasmāt tarhy ānanda tan nidānaṃ eṣa samudaya eṣa hetur eṣa pratyayo jarāmaraṇasya yad uta jātiḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi ānanda tat nidānam eṣa samudayaḥ eṣa hetuḥ eṣa pratyayaḥ jarā maraṇasya yat uta jātiḥ
translated: Therefore, Ānanda, this is the source, this is the origin, this is the birth, this is the beginning of old age and death, namely, birth.

original: jātipratyayam ānanda jarāmaraṇam iti me yad uktam DhskD
analyzed: jāti pratyayam ānanda jarā maraṇam iti me yat uktam
translated: Ānanda, when I said 'Old age and death have birth as their condition,' this is the answer to that.

original: etat pratyuktaṃ //
analyzed: etat pratyuktam
translated: This is the answer.

original: jarā katamā /
analyzed: jarā katamā
translated: What is old age?

original: yat tat khālityaṃ pālityaṃ vistareṇa yāvat saṃskārāṇāṃ purāṇībhāvo jarjarībhāva iyam ucyate jarā /
analyzed: yat tat khālityam pālityam vistareṇa yāvat saṃskārāṇām purāṇībhāvaḥ jarjarībhāvaḥ iyam ucyate jarā
translated: That which is baldness, grayness, and so on up to the aging of conditioned things, their decrepitude, is called old age.

original: maraṇaṃ katamad /
analyzed: maraṇam katamat
translated: What is death?

original: āha /🔽yat teṣāṃ teṣāṃ satvānāṃ tasmāt tasmāt satvanikāyāc DhskD
analyzed: āha  yat teṣām teṣām satvānām tasmāt tasmāt satva nikāyāt
translated: He says:🔽That which is the passing away, the falling away, the breaking up, the disappearance, the dying, the death, the completion, the breaking up of the body, the termination of the life faculty, the discarding of the heaps of the various sentient beings from the various classes of sentient beings,

original: cyutiś cyavanatā bhedo 'ntarhāṇiḥ saṃmoṣaḥ parihāṇiḥ āyuṣo hānir ūṣmaṇo hāniḥ skandhānāṃ nikṣepo jīvitendriyasyoparodho maraṇaṃ kālakriyā idam ucyate maraṇaṃ /
analyzed: cyutiḥ cyavana tā bhedaḥ ntarhāṇiḥ saṃmoṣaḥ parihāṇiḥ āyuṣaḥ hāniḥ ūṣmaṇaḥ hāniḥ skandhānām nikṣepaḥ jīvita indriyasya uparodhaḥ maraṇam kālakriyā idam ucyate maraṇam
translated: that is called death.

original: śokaḥ katama /
analyzed: śokaḥ katama
translated: What is sorrow?

original: āha DhskD /
analyzed: āha dhskd
translated: He says:

original: yat tan mātṛmaraṇena pitṛmaraṇena bhrātṛmaraṇena bhaginīmaraṇena jñātikṣayād dhanakṣayād
analyzed: yat tat mātṛ maraṇena pitṛ maraṇena bhrātṛ maraṇena bhaginī maraṇena jñāti kṣayāt dhana kṣayāt
translated: That which is being touched by the loss of one's mother, the loss of one's father, the loss of one's brother, the loss of one's sister, the loss of one's relatives, the loss of one's wealth,🔽the loss of one's enjoyments, and being afflicted by painful, sharp, severe, bitter,

original: bhogakṣayāt spṛṣṭasya śārīrikābhir vedanābhir duḥkhābis tīvrābhiḥ kharābhiḥ kaṭukābhir🔽amanāpābhiḥ DhskD
analyzed: bhoga kṣayāt spṛṣṭasya śārīrikābhiḥ vedanābhiḥ duḥkhābhiḥ tīvrābhiḥ kharābhiḥ kaṭukābhiḥ  amanāpābhiḥ dhskd
translated: life-taking physical sensations,

original: prāṇahāriṇībhir yo dāghaḥ saṃdāghaḥ śokaḥ śocanā śokāyitatvam ayam ucyate śokaḥ /
analyzed: prāṇa hāriṇībhiḥ yaḥ dāghaḥ saṃdāghaḥ śokaḥ śocanā śokāyita tvam ayam ucyate śokaḥ
translated: that is called sorrow.

original: paridevaḥ katama /
analyzed: paridevaḥ katama
translated: What is lamentation?

original: āha /
analyzed: āha
translated: He says:

original: tathā dahyate tathā paridahyate /
analyzed: tathā dahyate tathā paridahyate
translated: One is thus burned, thus scorched,

original: hā aṃba hā tāta hā bhagini hā bhrātaḥ /
analyzed: hā aṃba hā tāta hā bhagini hā bhrātar
translated: Alas, mother! Alas, father! Alas, sister! Alas, brother!

original: tad upādāya DhskD
analyzed: tat upādāya
translated: From that time on,

original: yad vākyaṃ vacanaṃ vyāhāro bhāṣā gīr niruktir vākpatho vāgghoṣo vācā vākkarma vāgvijñaptir
analyzed: yat vākyam vacanam vyāhāraḥ bhāṣā gīḥ niruktiḥ vāc pathaḥ vāc ghoṣaḥ vācā vāc karma vāc vijñaptiḥ
translated: whatever is a statement, speech, utterance, language, expression, path of speech, voice, sound of speech, action of speech, verbal intimation,

original: ārttir bhāṣyaṃ vipralāpo lālapyaṃ lālapyanatā paridevaḥ paridevanatā ayam ucyate
analyzed: ārttiḥ bhāṣyam vipralāpaḥ lālapyam lālapyana tā paridevaḥ paridevana tā ayam ucyate
translated: distress, talk, chatter, lamenting, lamenting nature, wailing, wailing nature, this is called

original: DhskD paridevaḥ /
analyzed: paridevaḥ
translated: lamenting.

original: duḥkhaṃ katamad /
analyzed: duḥkham katamat
translated: What is suffering?

original: āha /
analyzed: āha
translated: It is said:

original: paṃcavijñānasaṃprayuktam asātaṃ veditaṃ vedanāgatam idam ucyate duḥkhaṃ /
analyzed: paṃca vijñāna saṃprayuktam asātam veditam vedanā gatam idam ucyate duḥkham
translated: The unpleasant feeling associated with the five consciousnesses, which is included in feeling, is called suffering.

original: daurmanasyaṃ katarad /
analyzed: daurmanasyam katarat
translated: What is sorrow?

original: āha /
analyzed: āha
translated: It is said:

original: manovijñānaṃsaprayuktaṃ asātaṃ veditaṃ vedanāgatam idam ucyate daurmanasyaṃ DhskD /
analyzed: manaḥ vijñāna ṃsa prayuktam asātam veditam vedanā gatam idam ucyate daurmanasyam
translated: The unpleasant feeling associated with the mind consciousness, which is included in feeling, is called sorrow.

original: upāyāsaḥ katama /
analyzed: upāyāsaḥ katama
translated: What is distress?

original: āha /
analyzed: āha
translated: It is said:

original: yaś cetasa āyāsa upāyāsaḥ upāyāsanatā ayam ucyate upāyāsaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ cetasaḥ āyāsaḥ upāyāsaḥ upāyāsana tā ayam ucyate upāyāsaḥ
translated: Mental distress, distress, the state of being distressed, this is called distress.

original: duḥkhaskandhasyābhinirvṛttiḥ
analyzed: duḥkha skandhasya abhinirvṛttiḥ
translated: The manifestation of the mass of suffering

original: api khalv avidyāduḥkhaskandhaṃ pratītya saṃskāraduḥkhaskandhasyābhinirvṛttir bhavati DhskD
analyzed: api khalu avidyā duḥkha skandham pratītya saṃskāra duḥkha skandhasya abhinirvṛttiḥ bhavati
translated: Moreover, the manifestation of the mass of suffering of formations occurs in dependence on the mass of suffering of ignorance.🔽The appearance

original: prādurbhāvaḥ /
analyzed: prādurbhāvaḥ
translated: manifestation.

original: saṃskāraduḥkhaskandhaṃ pratītya vijñānaduḥkhaskandhasyābhinirvṛttir bhavati prādurbhāvaḥ /
analyzed: saṃskāra duḥkha skandham pratītya vijñāna duḥkha skandhasya abhinirvṛttiḥ bhavati prādurbhāvaḥ
translated: Dependent on the aggregate of suffering that is volitional formations, the aggregate of suffering that is consciousness comes into being, comes into manifestation.

original: vijñānaduḥkhaskandhaṃ pratītya nāmarūpaduḥkhaskandhasyābhinirvṛttir bhavati prādurbhāvaḥ /
analyzed: vijñāna duḥkha skandham pratītya nāma rūpa duḥkha skandhasya abhinirvṛttiḥ bhavati prādurbhāvaḥ
translated: Dependent on the aggregate of suffering that is consciousness, the aggregate of suffering that is name-and-form comes into being, comes into manifestation.

original: nāmarūpaduḥkhaskandhaṃ DhskD 🔽pratītya ṣaḍāyatanaduḥkhaskandhasyābhinirvṛttir bhavati prādurbhāvaḥ /
analyzed: nāma rūpa duḥkha skandham  pratītya ṣaṣ āyatana duḥkha skandhasya abhinirvṛttiḥ bhavati prādurbhāvaḥ
translated: Dependent on the aggregate of suffering that is name-and-form,🔽the aggregate of suffering that is the six sense bases comes into being, comes into manifestation.

original: ṣaḍāyatanaduḥkhaskandhaṃ pratītya sparśaduḥkhaskandhasyābhinirvṛttir bhavati prādurbhāvaḥ /
analyzed: ṣaṣ āyatana duḥkha skandham pratītya sparśa duḥkha skandhasya abhinirvṛttiḥ bhavati prādurbhāvaḥ
translated: Dependent on the aggregate of suffering that is the six sense bases, the aggregate of suffering that is contact comes into being, comes into manifestation.

original: sparśaduḥkhaskandhaṃ DhskD
analyzed: sparśa duḥkha skandham
translated: Dependent on the aggregate of suffering that is contact,

original: pratītya vedanāduḥkhaskandhasyābhinirvṛttir bhavati prādurbhāvaḥ /🔽vedanāduḥkhaskandhaṃ pratītya tṛṣṇāduḥkhaskandhasyābhinirvṛttir bhavati prādurbhāvaḥ /
analyzed: pratītya vedanā duḥkha skandhasya abhinirvṛttiḥ bhavati prādurbhāvaḥ  vedanā duḥkha skandham pratītya tṛṣṇā duḥkha skandhasya abhinirvṛttiḥ bhavati prādurbhāvaḥ
translated: the aggregate of suffering that is feeling comes into being, comes into manifestation.🔽Dependent on the aggregate of suffering that is feeling, the aggregate of suffering that is craving comes into being, comes into manifestation.

original: tṛṣṇāduḥkhaskandhaṃ pratītyopādānaduḥkhaskandhasyābhinirvṛttir DhskD 🔽bhavati prādurbhāvaḥ /
analyzed: tṛṣṇā duḥkha skandham pratītya upādāna duḥkha skandhasya abhinirvṛttiḥ 🔽bhavati prādurbhāvaḥ
translated: Dependent on the aggregate of suffering that is craving, the aggregate of suffering that is clinging comes into being, comes into manifestation.🔽Dependent on the aggregate of suffering that is clinging, the aggregate of suffering that is existence comes into being, comes into manifestation.

original: upādānaduḥkhaskandhaṃ pratītya bhavaduḥkhaskandhasyābhinirvṛttir bhavati prādurbhāvaḥ /
analyzed: upādāna duḥkha skandham pratītya bhava duḥkha skandhasya abhinirvṛttiḥ bhavati prādurbhāvaḥ
translated: Dependent on the mass of suffering of clinging, the mass of suffering of becoming comes into being, appears.

original: bhavaduḥkhaskandhaṃ pratītya jātiduḥkhaskandhasyābhinirvittir bhavati prādurbhāvaḥ /🔽jātiduḥkhaskandham DhskD
analyzed: bhava duḥkha skandham pratītya jāti duḥkha skandhasya abhinirvittiḥ bhavati prādurbhāvaḥ  jāti duḥkha skandham
translated: Dependent on the mass of suffering of becoming, the mass of suffering of birth comes into being, appears.🔽Dependent on the mass of suffering of birth,

original: pratītya jarāmaraṇaduḥkhaskandhasyābhinirvṛttir bhavati prādurbhāvaḥ //
analyzed: pratītya jarā maraṇa duḥkha skandhasya abhinirvṛttiḥ bhavati prādurbhāvaḥ
translated: the mass of suffering of old age and death comes into being, appears.

original: pañca bhayāni vadyāni vairāṇi
analyzed: pañca bhayāni vadyāni vairāṇi
translated: The five fears, reproaches, and enmities

original: evaṃ mayā śrutam ekasmin samaye bhagavāṃś chrāvastyāṃ viharati jetavane 'nāthapiṇḍadasyārāme /
analyzed: evam mayā śrutam ekasmin samaye bhagavān śrāvastyām viharati jetavane nāthapiṇḍadasya ārāme
translated: Thus have I heard. At one time the Blessed One was dwelling in Śrāvastī, in Jeta's Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada's park.

original: tatra bhagavān bhikṣūn āmantrayate sma /
analyzed: tatra bhagavān bhikṣūn āmantrayate sma
translated: There the Blessed One addressed the monks:

original: yasya kasya cid bhikṣavaḥ DhskD
analyzed: yasya kasya cid bhikṣavaḥ dhskd
translated: Monks, for whoever has

original: paṃca bhayāni vadyāni vairāṇi aśāntāni bhavanti sa dṛṣṭa eva dharme vijñānāṃ garhyo
analyzed: paṃca bhayāni vadyāni vairāṇi aśāntāni bhavanti sa dṛṣṭe eva dharme vijñānām garhyaḥ
translated: the five fears, reproaches, and enmities that are not pacified, he is reproached by the wise even in this life,

original: bhavati paścāc cānutāpyaḥ kāyasya ca bhedāt paraṃ maraṇād apāyadurgatiṃ vinipātaṃ narakeṣūpapadyate /
analyzed: bhavati paścāt ca anutāpyaḥ kāyasya ca bhedāt param maraṇāt apāya durgatim vinipātam narakeṣu upapadyate
translated: and later he has remorse. And upon the dissolution of the body, after death, he falls into misfortune, a bad destination, the lower realms, hell.

original: katamāni paṃca bhayāni DhskD
analyzed: katamāni paṃca bhayāni
translated: What are the five fears, reproaches, and enmities?

original: vadyāni vairāṇy aśāntāni bhavanti /
analyzed: vadyāni vairāṇi a śāntāni bhavanti
translated: The reproaches and enmities that are to be spoken are not pacified.

original: yat prāṇātipātikaḥ prāṇātipātapratyayaṃ vadyaṃ vairaṃ prasavati prāṇātipātād aprativiratasya evam asyedaṃ prathamaṃ bhayaṃ vadyaṃ vairam aśāntaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: yat prāṇātipātikaḥ prāṇa atipāta pratyayam vadyam vairam prasavati prāṇa atipātāt a prativiratasya evam asya idam prathamam bhayam vadyam vairam aśāntam bhavati
translated: When one who kills living beings generates a reproach and enmity on account of killing living beings, for one who does not abstain from killing living beings, this is the first fear, reproach, and enmity that is not pacified for him.

original: yad DhskD adattādāyikaḥ kāmamithyācāriko mṛṣāvādikaḥ
analyzed: yat adatta ādāyikaḥ kāma mithyācārikaḥ mṛṣāvādikaḥ
translated: When one who takes what is not given, who engages in sexual misconduct, who speaks falsely,

original: surāmaireyamadyapramādasthāyikaḥ surāmaireyamadyapramādasthānabhayaṃ vadyaṃ vairaṃ prasavati surāmaireyamadyapramādasthānād aprativiratasya DhskD
analyzed: surā maireya madya pramāda sthāyikaḥ surā maireya madya pramāda sthāna bhayam vadyam vairam prasavati surā maireya madya pramāda sthānāt aprativiratasya dhskd
translated: who abides in the state of heedlessness due to strong liquor, who generates a fear of reproach and enmity on account of the state of heedlessness due to strong liquor, for one who does not abstain from the state of heedlessness due to strong liquor,

original: evam asyedaṃ paṃcamaṃ bhayaṃ vadyaṃ vairam aśāntaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: evam asya idam paṃcamam bhayam vadyam vairam aśāntam bhavati
translated: this is the fifth fear, reproach, and enmity that is not pacified for him.

original: yasya kasya cid imāni paṃca bhayāni vadyāni vairāṇy aśāntāni bhavanti sa dṛṣṭa eva dharme vijñānāṃ garhyo bhavati paścāc cānutāpyaḥ /
analyzed: yasya kasya cit imāni paṃca bhayāni vadyāni vairāṇi a śāntāni bhavanti sa dṛṣṭe eva dharme vijñānām garhyaḥ bhavati paścāt ca anutāpyaḥ
translated: For whoever has these five fears, reproaches, and enmities that are not pacified, he is reproached by the wise in this very life and has regret afterwards.

original: DhskD kāyasya bhedāt paraṃ maraṇād apāyadurgatiṃ vinipātaṃ narakeṣūpapadyate /
analyzed: kāyasya bhedāt param maraṇāt apāya durgatim vinipātam narakeṣu upapadyate
translated: With the dissolution of the body, after death, he is reborn in a bad destination, an unfortunate state, in hell.

original: yasya tu kasya cit paṃca bhayāni vadyāni vairāṇi śāntāni bhavanti sa dṛṣṭa eva dharme vijñānāṃ praśasyo bhavati paścāc ca nānutāpyaḥ DhskD
analyzed: yasya tu kasya cit paṃca bhayāni vadyāni vairāṇi śāntāni bhavanti sa dṛṣṭe eva dharme vijñānām praśasyaḥ bhavati paścāt ca na anutāpyaḥ dhskd
translated: But for whoever, whatever five fears, dangers, and enmities are pacified, he is praised by the wise in this very life and does not repent afterwards.

original: kāyasya ca bhedāt sugatau svargaloke deveṣūpapadyate /
analyzed: kāyasya ca bhedāt sugatau svarga loke deveṣu upapadyate
translated: And upon the dissolution of the body, after death, he is reborn in a good realm, in the heavenly world among the gods.

original: katamāni paṃca bhayāni vadyāni vairāṇi śāntāni bhavanti /
analyzed: katamāni paṃca bhayāni vadyāni vairāṇi śāntāni bhavanti
translated: What are the five fears, dangers, and enmities that are pacified?

original: yat prāṇātipātikaḥ prāṇātipātapratyayaṃ bhayaṃ vadyaṃ vairaṃ prasavati prāṇātipātāt DhskD
analyzed: yat prāṇātipātikaḥ prāṇa atipāta pratyayam bhayam vadyam vairam prasavati prāṇa atipātāt
translated: One who kills living beings, on account of killing living beings, generates fear, danger, and enmity.

original: prativiratasya evam asyedaṃ prathamaṃ vadyaṃ vairaṃ śāntaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: prativiratasya evam asya idam prathamam vadyam vairam śāntam bhavati
translated: For one who abstains from killing living beings, in this way this first danger, enmity, and fear is pacified.

original: yad adattādāyikaḥ kāmamithyācāriko mṛṣāvādikaḥ🔽surāmaireyamadyapramādasthāyikaḥ surāmaireyamadyapramādasthānapratyayaṃ DhskD
analyzed: yat a datta ādāyikaḥ kāma mithyā ācārikaḥ mṛṣāvādikaḥ  surā maireya madya pramāda sthāyikaḥ surā maireya madya pramāda sthāna pratyayam
translated: One who takes what is not given, engages in sexual misconduct, speaks falsely,🔽and indulges in intoxicants that cause negligence, on account of the basis of negligence through intoxicants, generates fear, danger, and enmity.

original: bhayaṃ vadyaṃ vairaṃ prasavati surāmaireyamadyapramādasthānāt prativiratasya evam asyedaṃ paṃcamaṃ bhayaṃ vadyaṃ vairaṃ śāntaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: bhayam vadyam vairam prasavati surā maireya madya pramāda sthānāt prativiratasya evam asya idam paṃcamam bhayam vadyam vairam śāntam bhavati
translated: For one who abstains from the basis of negligence through intoxicants, in this way this fifth fear, danger, and enmity is pacified.

original: yasya kasya cid imāni paṃca bhayāni vadyāni vairāṇi śāntāni bhavanti sa dṛṣṭa eva dharme DhskD
analyzed: yasya kasya cit imāni paṃca bhayāni vadyāni vairāṇi śāntāni bhavanti sa dṛṣṭe eva dharme
translated: For whoever these five fears, these five dangers, these five enemies are pacified, he has in this very life🔽

original: vijñānāṃ praśasyo bhavati paścāc ca nānutāpyaḥ kāyasya ca bhedāt sugatau svargaloke deveṣūpapadyate /
analyzed: vijñānām praśasyaḥ bhavati paścāt ca na anutāpyaḥ kāyasya ca bhedāt sugatau svarga loke deveṣu upapadyate
translated: For whoever these five fears, reproaches, and enmities are pacified, he is praised by the wise in this very life and does not repent afterwards. And upon the dissolution of the body, after death, he is reborn in a good destiny, in a heavenly world among the gods.

original: idam avocad bhagavān /
analyzed: idam avocat bhagavān
translated: This was said by the Blessed One.

original: idam uktvā sugato hy athāparam etad uvāca śāstā //
analyzed: idam uktvā sugataḥ hi atha aparam etat uvāca śāstā
translated: Having said this, the Well-Gone One, the Teacher, spoke further:

original: yaḥ prāṇam atipātayati mṛṣāvādaṃ DhskD ca bhāṣate /
analyzed: yaḥ prāṇam atipātayati mṛṣāvādam ca bhāṣate
translated: He who takes life, speaks falsehood,

original: loke adattam ādatte paradāraṃ ca gacchati /
analyzed: loke adattam ādatte paradāram ca gacchati
translated: Takes what is not given, goes to another's wife,

original: surāmaireyapānaṃ ca yo naro hy adhigṛdhyati /
analyzed: surā maireya pānam ca yaḥ naraḥ hi adhigṛdhyati
translated: And the man who craves for drinking sura and maireya,

original: saktaḥ paṃcasu dharmeṣu duḥśīla iti kathyate /
analyzed: saktaḥ paṃcasu dharmeṣu duḥśīlaḥ iti kathyate
translated: Being attached to these five things, is called immoral.

original: kāyasya bhedād duṣprajño narakeṣūpapadyate //
analyzed: kāyasya bhedāt duṣprajñaḥ narakeṣu upapadyate
translated: Due to the dissolution of the body, the one with poor wisdom is reborn in the hells.

original: yas tu prāṇaṃ nātipātayati DhskD
analyzed: yaḥ tu prāṇam na atipātayati
translated: But he who does not take life,

original: mṛṣāvādaṃ na bhāṣate /
analyzed: mṛṣāvādam na bhāṣate
translated: Does not speak falsehood,

original: loke adattaṃ nādatte paradāraṃ na gacchati /
analyzed: loke adattam na ādatte paradāram na gacchati
translated: Does not take what is not given in the world, does not go to another's wife,

original: surāmaireyapānaṃ ca yo naro nādhigṛdhyati /
analyzed: surā maireya pānam ca yaḥ naraḥ na adhigṛdhyati
translated: And the man who does not crave for drinking sura and maireya,

original: muktaḥ paṃcasu dharmeṣu śīlavān iti kathyate /
analyzed: muktaḥ paṃcasu dharmeṣu śīlavān iti kathyate
translated: Being free from these five things, is called virtuous.

original: kāyasya bhedāt sugato svargaloke deveṣūpapadyate /
analyzed: kāyasya bhedāt sugataḥ svarga loke deveṣu upapadyate
translated: Having separated from the body, the well-gone one is reborn in the heavenly world of the gods.

original: idam DhskD avocat //
analyzed: idam dhskd avocat
translated: This was said.

original: upāsakaḥ
analyzed: upāsakaḥ
translated: Lay follower

original: kiyatā upāsako bhavati /
analyzed: kiyatā upāsakaḥ bhavati
translated: In what way does one become a lay follower?

original: yataś ca gṛhī avadātavasanaḥ puruṣaḥ puruṣendriyeṇa samanvāgataḥ buddhaṃ śaraṇaṃ gacchati dharmaṃ saṃghaṃ śaraṇaṃ gacchati cittam utpādayati vācaṃ ca bhāṣate upāsakaṃ DhskD
analyzed: yatas ca gṛhī avadāta vasanaḥ puruṣaḥ puruṣa indriyeṇa samanvāgataḥ buddham śaraṇam gacchati dharmam saṃgham śaraṇam gacchati cittam utpādayati vācam ca bhāṣate upāsakam dhskd
translated: And when a householder, wearing white clothes, a man with a man's faculty, goes for refuge to the Buddha, goes for refuge to the Dharma, goes for refuge to the Saṅgha, generates the thought, and utters the words: 'Consider me a lay follower who has gone for refuge'

original: māṃ dhārayeti /
analyzed: mām dhāraya iti
translated: up to 'Consider me a lay follower who has gone for refuge.'

original: iyatā upāsako bhavati /
analyzed: iyatā upāsakaḥ bhavati
translated: In this way one becomes a lay follower.

original: kiyatā upāsakaḥ śikṣāsv ekadeśakārī bhavati /🔽yataś copāsakaḥ buddhaṃ śaraṇaṃ gato bhavati dharmaṃ saṃghaṃ śaraṇaṃ gato bhavati prāṇātipātāt DhskD
analyzed: kiyatā upāsakaḥ śikṣāsu eka deśa kārī bhavati  yatas ca upāsakaḥ buddham śaraṇam gataḥ bhavati dharmam saṃgham śaraṇam gataḥ bhavati prāṇa atipātāt dhsk
translated: In what way does a lay follower practice one part of the training?

original: prativirataḥ adattādānāt kāmamithyācārān mṛṣāvādād aprativirataḥ iyatā upāsakaḥ śikṣāsv ekadeśakārī bhavati /🔽kiyatā upāsakaḥ śikṣāsu DhskD
analyzed: prativirataḥ a datta ādānāt kāma mithyā ācārāt mṛṣāvādāt a prativirataḥ iyatā upāsakaḥ śikṣāsu ekadeśa kārī bhavati  kiyatā upāsakaḥ śikṣāsu dhskd
translated: And when a lay follower has gone for refuge to the Buddha, has gone for refuge to the Dharma, has gone for refuge to the Saṅgha, abstains from killing living beings, abstains from taking what is not given, abstains from sexual misconduct, abstains from false speech, in this way a lay follower practices one part of the training.

original: pradeśakārī bhavati /
analyzed: pradeśa kārī bhavati
translated: In what way does a lay follower practice two parts of the training?🔽In what way does a lay follower practice three parts of the training?🔽In what way does a lay follower practice four parts of the training?

original: yataś copāsakaḥ buddhaṃ śaraṇaṃ gato bhavati dharmaṃ saṃghaṃ śaraṇaṃ gato bhavati
analyzed: yatas ca upāsakaḥ buddham śaraṇam gataḥ bhavati dharmam saṃgham śaraṇam gataḥ bhavati
translated: And when a lay follower has gone for refuge to the Buddha, has gone for refuge to the Dharma, has gone for refuge to the Saṅgha,

original: prāṇātipātād adattādānāt prativirataḥ kāmamithyācārān mṛṣāvādāt surāmaireyamadyapramādasthānād DhskD
analyzed: prāṇa atipātāt a datta ādānāt prativirataḥ kāma mithyā ācārāt mṛṣāvādāt surā maireya madya pramāda sthānāt
translated: has abstained from killing living creatures, from taking what is not given, from sexual activity, from false speech, from fermented and distilled liquors that cause heedlessness,

original: aprativirataḥ iyatā upāsakaḥ śikṣāsu pradeśakārī bhavati /
analyzed: aprativirataḥ iyatā upāsakaḥ śikṣāsu pradeśakārī bhavati
translated: to that extent a lay follower is one who practices partially in the trainings.

original: kiyatā upāsakaḥ śikṣāsu yadbhūyaskārī bhavati /
analyzed: kiyatā upāsakaḥ śikṣāsu yat bhūyaskārī bhavati
translated: To what extent is a lay follower one who practices mostly in the trainings?

original: yataś copāsakaḥ buddhaṃ śaraṇaṃ gato bhavati dharmaṃ saṃghaṃ śaraṇaṃ DhskD
analyzed: yatas ca upāsakaḥ buddham śaraṇam gataḥ bhavati dharmam saṃgham śaraṇam
translated: And when a lay follower has gone for refuge to the Buddha, has gone for refuge to the Dharma, has gone for refuge to the Saṅgha,

original: gato bhavati prāṇātipātād adattādānāt kāmamithyācārāt prativirataḥ mṛṣāvādāt surāmaireyamadyapramādasthānād aprativirataḥ iyatā upāsakaḥ śikṣāsu yadbhūyaskāri bhavati /
analyzed: gataḥ bhavati prāṇa atipātāt a datta ādānāt kāma mithyā ācārāt prativirataḥ mṛṣāvādāt surā maireya madya pramāda sthānāt a prativirataḥ iyatā upāsakaḥ śikṣāsu yat bhūyaskāri bhavati
translated: has abstained from killing living creatures, from taking what is not given, from sexual activity, has not abstained from false speech, from fermented and distilled liquors that cause heedlessness, to that extent a lay follower is one who practices mostly in the trainings.

original: DhskD kiyatā upāsakaḥ śikṣāsv aparipūrṇakārī bhavati /
analyzed: kiyatā upāsakaḥ śikṣāsu a paripūrṇa kārī bhavati
translated: To what extent is a lay follower one who practices incompletely in the trainings?

original: yataś copāsakaḥ buddhaṃ śaraṇaṃ gato bhavati dharmaṃ saṃghaṃ śaraṇaṃ gato bhavati
analyzed: yatas ca upāsakaḥ buddham śaraṇam gataḥ bhavati dharmam saṃgham śaraṇam gataḥ bhavati
translated: And when a lay follower has gone for refuge to the Buddha, has gone for refuge to the Dharma, has gone for refuge to the Saṅgha,

original: prāṇātipātād adattādānāt kāmamithyācārān mṛṣāvādāt prativirataḥ surāmaireyamadyapramādasthānād DhskD
analyzed: prāṇa atipātāt a datta ādānāt kāma mithyā ācārāt mṛṣāvādāt prativirataḥ surā maireya madya pramāda sthānāt
translated: One who abstains from killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, false speech, and the basis for negligence of surā, maireya, and madya,

original: aprativirataḥ iyatā upāsakaḥ śikṣāsv aparipūrṇakārī bhavati /
analyzed: a prativirataḥ iyatā upāsakaḥ śikṣāsu a paripūrṇa kārī bhavati
translated: to that extent an upāsaka is one who has not fulfilled the trainings.

original: kiyatā upāsakaḥ śikṣāsu paripūrṇakārī bhavati /
analyzed: kiyatā upāsakaḥ śikṣāsu paripūrṇa kārī bhavati
translated: To what extent is an upāsaka one who has fulfilled the trainings?

original: yataś copāsakaḥ buddhaṃ śaraṇaṃ gato bhavati dharmaṃ saṃghaṃ śaraṇaṃ gato bhavati prāṇātipātāt DhskD
analyzed: yatas ca upāsakaḥ buddham śaraṇam gataḥ bhavati dharmam saṃgham śaraṇam gataḥ bhavati prāṇa atipātāt dhsk
translated: When an upāsaka has gone for refuge to the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha, and has gone for refuge to abstaining from killing,

original: prativirataḥ adattādānāt kāmamithyācārān mṛṣāvādāt surāmaireyamadyapramādasthānāt prativirataḥ iyatā upāsakaḥ śikṣāsu paripūrṇakārī bhavati
analyzed: prativirataḥ adatta ādānāt kāma mithyā ācārāt mṛṣāvādāt surā maireya madya pramāda sthānāt prativirataḥ iyatā upāsakaḥ śikṣāsu paripūrṇa kārī bhavati
translated: to abstaining from stealing, sexual misconduct, false speech, and the basis for negligence of surā, maireya, and madya, to that extent an upāsaka is one who has fulfilled the trainings.

original: paṃcabhir dharmaiḥ samanvāgataḥ upāsakaḥ DhskD
analyzed: paṃcabhiḥ dharmaiḥ samanvāgataḥ upāsakaḥ dhskd
translated: An upāsaka endowed with five qualities

original: ātmahitāya pratipanno bhavati na parahitāya /
analyzed: ātma hitāya pratipannaḥ bhavati na para hitāya
translated: is one who practices for his own benefit, but not for the benefit of others.

original: katamaiḥ paṃcabhiḥ /
analyzed: katamaiḥ paṃcabhiḥ
translated: With which five?

original: ātmanā prāṇātipātāt prativirato bhavati /
analyzed: ātmanā prāṇa atipātāt prativirataḥ bhavati
translated: One abstains from killing oneself,

original: no tu parān prāṇātipātaviratau samādāpayati /
analyzed: no tu parān prāṇa atipāta viratau samādāpayati
translated: but does not encourage others to abstain from killing.

original: ātmanā DhskD
analyzed: ātmanā
translated: One abstains from stealing oneself,🔽but does not encourage others to abstain from stealing.

original: kāmamithyācārān mṛṣāvādāt surāmaireyamadyapramādasthānāt prativirato bhavati /
analyzed: kāma mithyā ācārāt mṛṣāvādāt surā maireya madya pramāda sthānāt prativirataḥ bhavati
translated: He abstains from sexual misconduct, from false speech, and from the occasion of heedlessness through fermented and distilled liquors.

original: no tu parān surāmaireyamadyapramādasthānaviratau samādāpayati /
analyzed: no tu parān surā maireya madya pramāda sthāna viratau samādāpayati
translated: But he does not encourage others to abstain from the occasion of heedlessness through fermented and distilled liquors.

original: ebhiḥ paṃcabhiḥ DhskD
analyzed: ebhiḥ paṃcabhiḥ dhskd
translated: With these five dharmas,

original: dharmaiḥ samanvāgata upāsaka ātmahitāya pratipanno bhavati parahitāya //
analyzed: dharmaiḥ samanvāgataḥ upāsakaḥ ātma hitāya pratipannaḥ bhavati para hitāya
translated: the lay follower is practicing for his own benefit and for the benefit of others.

original: daśabhir dharmaiḥ samanvāgata upāsakaḥ ātmahitāya pratipanno bhavati parahitāya ca /🔽ātmanā prāṇātipātāt prativirato DhskD
analyzed: daśabhiḥ dharmaiḥ samanvāgataḥ upāsakaḥ ātma hitāya pratipannaḥ bhavati para hitāya ca  ātmanā prāṇa atipātāt prativirataḥ
translated: The lay follower who is endowed with ten dharmas is practicing for his own benefit and for the benefit of others.

original: bhavati parāṃś ca prāṇātipātaviratau samādāpayati /🔽ātmanā adattādānāt kāmamithyācārān mṛṣāvādāt surāmaireyamadyapramādasthānāt prativirato bhavati parāṃś ca surāmaireyamadyapramādasthānaviratau DhskD
analyzed: bhavati parān ca prāṇa atipāta viratau samādāpayati  ātmanā adatta ādānāt kāma mithyā ācārāt mṛṣāvādāt surā maireya madya pramāda sthānāt prativirataḥ bhavati parān ca surā maireya madya pramāda sthāna viratau
translated: He himself abstains from killing living beings and encourages others to abstain from killing living beings.

original: samādāpayati /
analyzed: samādāpayati
translated: He himself abstains from taking what is not given, from sexual misconduct, from false speech, and from the occasion of heedlessness through fermented and distilled liquors, and he encourages others to abstain from the occasion of heedlessness through fermented and distilled liquors.

original: ebhir daśabhir dharmais samanvāgataḥ upāsakaḥ ātmahitāya pratipanno bhavati parahitāya ca //
analyzed: ebhiḥ daśabhiḥ dharmaiḥ samanvāgataḥ upāsakaḥ ātma hitāya pratipannaḥ bhavati para hitāya ca
translated: With these ten dharmas, the lay follower is practicing for his own benefit and for the benefit of others.

original: paṃcadaśabhir dharmais samanvāgata upāsakaḥ atmāhitāya pratipanno bhavati parahitāya ca DhskD
analyzed: paṃcadaśabhiḥ dharmaiḥ samanvāgataḥ upāsakaḥ ātma ahitāya pratipannaḥ bhavati para hitāya ca
translated: A lay follower endowed with fifteen qualities practices for his own benefit and for the benefit of others,

original: bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya ca /
analyzed: bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya ca
translated: for the welfare, benefit, and happiness of many people.

original: ātmanā prāṇātipātāt prativirato bhavati parān api prāṇātipātaviratau samādāpayati prāṇātipātavirataṃ ca dṛṣṭvā sumanojño bhavati /🔽ātmanā DhskD
analyzed: ātmanā prāṇa atipātāt prativirataḥ bhavati parān api prāṇa atipāta viratau samādāpayati prāṇa atipāta viratam ca dṛṣṭvā su manojñaḥ bhavati  ātmanā dhskd
translated: He himself abstains from killing living beings, and he encourages others to abstain from killing living beings, and he is pleased when he sees others abstaining from killing living beings.

original: adattādānāt kāmamithyācārān mṛṣāvādāt surāmaireyamadyapramādasthānaviratau samādāpayati surāmaireyamadyapramādasthānavirataṃ ca dṛṣṭvā sumanojño bhavaty /
analyzed: a datta ādānāt kāma mithyā ācārāt mṛṣāvādāt surā maireya madya pramāda sthāna viratau samādāpayati surā maireya madya pramāda sthāna viratam ca dṛṣṭvā su manojñaḥ bhavati
translated: He himself abstains from taking what is not given, from sexual misconduct, from false speech, and from alcoholic drinks that cause negligence, and he encourages others to abstain from these, and he is pleased when he sees others abstaining from these.

original: ebhiḥ paṃcadaśabhir dharmaiḥ DhskD
analyzed: ebhiḥ paṃcadaśabhiḥ dharmaiḥ dhskd
translated: Endowed with these fifteen qualities,

original: samanvāgataḥ upāsakaḥ ātmahitāya pratipanno bhavati parahitāya bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya ca //
analyzed: samanvāgataḥ upāsakaḥ ātma hitāya pratipannaḥ bhavati para hitāya bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya ca
translated: a lay follower practices for his own benefit and for the benefit of others, for the welfare, benefit, and happiness of many people.

original: aṣṭābhir dharmais samanvāgata upāsakaḥ ātmahitāya pratipanno bhavati na parahitāya /🔽ātmanā DhskD
analyzed: aṣṭābhiḥ dharmaiḥ samanvāgataḥ upāsakaḥ ātma hitāya pratipannaḥ bhavati na para hitāya 🔽ātmanā dhskd
translated: A lay follower endowed with eight qualities practices for his own benefit but not for the benefit of others.🔽He himself abstains from killing living beings, and he encourages others to abstain from killing living beings, and he is pleased when he sees others abstaining from killing living beings.

original: śraddhāsaṃpanno bhavati no tu parāṃ cchraddhāsaṃpadi samādāpayati /
analyzed: śraddhā saṃpannaḥ bhavati no tu parām śraddhā saṃpadi samādāpayati
translated: He is endowed with faith, but does not encourage others to attain the highest degree of faith.

original: ātmānā śīlasaṃpannas tyāgasaṃpannaḥ /
analyzed: ātmānā śīla saṃpannaḥ tyāga saṃpannaḥ
translated: He himself is endowed with morality, generosity,

original: abhīkṣṇam ārāmaṃ gantā bhavati bhikṣūṇāṃ darśanāya /🔽avahitaśrotro dharmaṃ śṛṇoti /
analyzed: abhīkṣṇam ārāmam gantā bhavati bhikṣūṇām darśanāya  avahita śrotraḥ dharmam śṛṇoti
translated: and often goes to the monastery to see the monks.🔽With attentive ears, he listens to the Dharma.

original: śrutānāṃ dharmāṇāṃ dhāraṇajātīyo bhavati DhskD /
analyzed: śrutānām dharmāṇām dhāraṇa jātīyaḥ bhavati
translated: He is of the type to retain the teachings he has heard.

original: dhṛtānāṃ dharmāṇām arthopaparīkṣī bhavati /
analyzed: dhṛtānām dharmāṇām artha upaparīkṣī bhavati
translated: He examines the meaning of the teachings he has retained.

original: ātmanā upaparīkṣitānāṃ dharmāṇām artham ājñāya dharmam ājñāya dharmānudharmapratipanno🔽bhavati sāmīcīpratipanno 'nudharma no tu parān dharmacārī no tu parān dharmānudharmapratipattau DhskD
analyzed: ātmanā upaparīkṣitānām dharmāṇām artham ājñāya dharmam ājñāya dharma anudharma pratipannaḥ  bhavati sāmīcī pratipannaḥ nu dharma no tu parān dharma cārī no tu parān dharma anudharma pratipattau
translated: Having understood the meaning and the teachings through self-examination, he practices the Dharma in accordance with the teachings.

original: samādāpayati /
analyzed: samādāpayati
translated: He practices correctly, but does not encourage others to practice the Dharma in accordance with the teachings.

original: ebhir aṣṭābhir dharmaiḥ samanvāgataḥ upāsakaḥ ātmahitāya pratipanno bhavati na parahitāya /🔽ṣoḍaśabhir dharmaiḥ samanvāgata upāsakaḥ ātmahitāya pratipanno bhavati DhskD
analyzed: ebhiḥ aṣṭābhiḥ dharmaiḥ samanvāgataḥ upāsakaḥ ātma hitāya pratipannaḥ bhavati na para hitāya  ṣoḍaśabhiḥ dharmaiḥ samanvāgataḥ upāsakaḥ ātma hitāya pratipannaḥ bhavati
translated: He is endowed with these eight qualities, the lay follower practices for his own benefit, but not for the benefit of others.

original: parahitāya ca /
analyzed: para hitāya ca
translated: The lay follower endowed with sixteen qualities practices for his own benefit and for the benefit of others.

original: ātmanā śraddhāsaṃpanno bhavati parān api śraddhāsaṃpadi samādāpayati /
analyzed: ātmanā śraddhā saṃpannaḥ bhavati parān api śraddhā saṃpadi samādāpayati
translated: One is oneself endowed with faith, and one encourages others to be endowed with faith.

original: ātmanā śīlasaṃpannas tyāgasaṃpanno bhavaty /
analyzed: ātmanā śīla saṃpannaḥ tyāga saṃpannaḥ bhavati
translated: One is oneself endowed with virtue, generosity,

original: ātmanā abhīkṣṇam ārāmaṃ gantā bhavati bhikṣūṇāṃ darśanāya /
analyzed: ātmanā abhīkṣṇam ārāmam gantā bhavati bhikṣūṇām darśanāya
translated: and wisdom. One is oneself a frequent visitor to the monastery to see the monks.

original: avahitaśrotro DhskD
analyzed: avahita śrotraḥ dhskd
translated: One listens with an attentive ear.

original: dharmaṃ śṛṇoti /
analyzed: dharmam śṛṇoti
translated: One hears the Dharma.

original: śrutānāṃ dharmāṇāṃ dhāraṇajātīyo bhavati /
analyzed: śrutānām dharmāṇām dhāraṇa jātīyaḥ bhavati
translated: One is of the type to retain the Dharmas that one has heard.

original: dhṛtānāṃ dharmāṇāṃ upaparīkṣaṇajātīyo bhavati /
analyzed: dhṛtānām dharmāṇām upaparīkṣaṇa jātīyaḥ bhavati
translated: One is of the type to investigate the Dharmas that one has retained.

original: ātmanā upaparīkṣitānāṃ dharmāṇām artham ājñāya dharmaṃ ājñāya dharmānudharmapratipanno DhskD bhavati /
analyzed: ātmanā upaparīkṣitānām dharmāṇām artham ājñāya dharmam ājñāya dharma anudharma pratipannaḥ dhskd bhavati
translated: Having investigated the Dharmas, one understands the meaning, understands the Dharma, and practices the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma.

original: sāmīcīpratipanno 'nudharmacārī parāṃś ca dharmānudharmapratipattau samādāpayati /
analyzed: sāmīcī pratipannaḥ nu dharma cārī parān ca dharma anudharma pratipattau samādāpayati
translated: One practices correctly, and one encourages others to practice the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma.

original: ebhiḥ ṣoḍaśabhir dharmaiḥ samanvāgata upāsaka ātmahitāya DhskD
analyzed: ebhiḥ ṣoḍaśabhiḥ dharmaiḥ samanvāgataḥ upāsakaḥ ātma hitāya
translated: The lay follower who possesses these sixteen qualities practices for his own benefit and for the benefit of others.

original: pratipanno bhavati parahitāya ca /
analyzed: pratipannaḥ bhavati para hitāya ca
translated: He practices for the benefit of many people and for the happiness of many people.

original: caturviṃśatyā dharmais samanvāgata upāsakaḥ ātmahitāya pratipanno bhavati parahitāya bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya ca /
analyzed: caturviṃśatyā dharmaiḥ samanvāgataḥ upāsakaḥ ātma hitāya pratipannaḥ bhavati para hitāya bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya ca
translated: The lay follower who possesses twenty-four qualities practices for his own benefit and for the benefit of others, for the benefit of many people and for the happiness of many people.

original: ātmanā śraddhāsaṃpanno bhavati parān DhskD
analyzed: ātmanā śraddhā saṃpannaḥ bhavati parān
translated: One is oneself endowed with faith, and one encourages others

original: api śraddhāsaṃpadi samādāpayati śraddhāsaṃpannaṃ ca dṛṣṭvā sumanojño bhavati /
analyzed: api śraddhā saṃpadi samādāpayati śraddhā saṃpannam ca dṛṣṭvā su manojñaḥ bhavati
translated: to be endowed with faith. Seeing one who is endowed with faith, one is delighted.

original: ātmanā śīlasaṃpannaḥ tyāgasaṃpannaḥ /
analyzed: ātmanā śīla saṃpannaḥ tyāga saṃpannaḥ
translated: One is oneself endowed with morality, generosity,

original: abhīkṣṇam ārāmaṃ gantā bhavati bhikṣūṇāṃ darśanāya /🔽avahitaśrotro dharmaṃ śṛṇoti /🔽śrutānāṃ DhskD
analyzed: abhīkṣṇam ārāmam gantā bhavati bhikṣūṇām darśanāya  avahita śrotraḥ dharmam śṛṇoti  śrutānām dhskd
translated: and wisdom. One often goes to the monastery to see the monks.🔽With attentive ears, one listens to the Dharma.

original: dharmāṇāṃ dhāraṇajātīyo bhavati /
analyzed: dharmāṇām dhāraṇa jātīyaḥ bhavati
translated: One is of the type to remember the teachings one has heard.

original: dhṛtānāṃ dharmāṇām arthopaparikṣī bhavati /
analyzed: dhṛtānām dharmāṇām artha upaparikṣī bhavati
translated: One examines the meaning of the teachings one has remembered.

original: ātmanā upaparikṣitānāṃ dharmāṇām artham ājñāya dharmam ājñāya dharmānudharmapratipanno bhavati sāmīcīpratipanno 'nudharmacār DhskD /
analyzed: ātmanā upaparikṣitānām dharmāṇām artham ājñāya dharmam ājñāya dharma anudharma pratipannaḥ bhavati sāmīcī pratipannaḥ
translated: Having understood the meaning of the teachings one has examined, having understood the Dharma, one practices in accordance with the Dharma, practicing correctly, practicing in accordance with the Dharma.

original: parān api dharmānudharmapratipattau samādāpayati /
analyzed: parān api dharma anudharma pratipattau samādāpayati
translated: One encourages others to practice in accordance with the Dharma.

original: dharmānudharmapratipannaṃ ca dṛṣṭvā sumanojño bhavati /
analyzed: dharma anudharma pratipannam ca dṛṣṭvā su manojñaḥ bhavati
translated: Seeing one who practices in accordance with the Dharma, one is delighted.

original: ebhiś caturviṃśatyā dharmaiḥ samanvāgata upāsakaḥ ātmahitāya pratipanno bhavati parahitāya bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya DhskD ca //
analyzed: ebhiḥ caturviṃśatyā dharmaiḥ samanvāgataḥ upāsakaḥ ātma hitāya pratipannaḥ bhavati para hitāya bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya dhskd ca
translated: And, endowed with these twenty-four qualities, the lay follower practices for his own benefit, for the benefit of others, for the benefit of many people, for the happiness of many people, for the sake of compassion for the world, for the welfare, benefit, and happiness of gods and humans.

original: daśabhir dharmais samanvāgata upāsakaḥ kāyasya bhedāt paraṃ maraṇād apāyadurgativinipātaṃ narakeṣūpapadyate /
analyzed: daśabhiḥ dharmaiḥ samanvāgataḥ upāsakaḥ kāyasya bhedāt param maraṇāt apāya durgati vinipātam narakeṣu upapadyate
translated: Endowed with ten qualities, the lay follower, upon the dissolution of the body, after death, is reborn in a bad realm of existence, in an unfortunate state, in the hells.

original: ātmanā prāṇātipātiko bhavati /🔽adattādāyikaḥ kāmamithyācāriko mṛṣāvādikaḥ piśunavādikaḥ DhskD
analyzed: ātmanā prāṇa atipātikaḥ bhavati  adatta ādāyikaḥ kāma mithyācārikaḥ mṛṣāvādikaḥ piśuna vādikaḥ
translated: He himself kills living beings.

original: paruṣavādikaḥ saṃbhinnapralāpiko 'bhidhyālur vyāpannacitto mithyādṛṣṭikaś ca bhavati /
analyzed: paruṣa vādikaḥ saṃbhinnapralāpikaḥ bhidhyāluḥ vyāpanna cittaḥ mithyādṛṣṭikaḥ ca bhavati
translated: He takes what is not given. He engages in sexual misconduct. He speaks falsely. He speaks divisively. He speaks harshly. He indulges in idle chatter. He is covetous. He has a malicious mind. He has wrong views.

original: ebhir daśabhir dharmaiḥ samanvāgata upāsakaḥ kāyasya bhedād yāvan narakeṣūpapadyate /🔽viṃśatyā dharmaiḥ samanvāgata upāsakaḥ kāyasya bhedād yāvan DhskD
analyzed: ebhiḥ daśabhiḥ dharmaiḥ samanvāgataḥ upāsakaḥ kāyasya bhedāt yāvat narakeṣu upapadyate  viṃśatyā dharmaiḥ samanvāgataḥ upāsakaḥ kāyasya bhedāt yāvan
translated: Endowed with these ten qualities, the lay follower, upon the dissolution of the body, is reborn in a bad realm of existence, in an unfortunate state, in the hells.

original: narakeṣūpapadyate /
analyzed: narakeṣu upapadyate
translated: Endowed with twenty qualities, the lay follower, upon the dissolution of the body, is reborn in a bad realm of existence, in an unfortunate state, in the hells.

original: ātmanā prāṇātipātiko bhavati parān api prāṇātipāte samādāpayati /
analyzed: ātmanā prāṇātipātikaḥ bhavati parān api prāṇātipāte samādāpayati
translated: He himself kills living beings. He encourages others to kill living beings.

original: ātmanā adattādāyiko yāvan mithyādṛṣṭikaḥ /

original: DhskD yat tat karma yo 'sau prayogaḥ yā sā ūhā yad upakramaṃ yat tat prāṇino hananaṃ māraṇaṃ saṃcintya jīvitād vyaparopaṇaṃ ayaṃ ucyate prāṇātipātaḥ //

translated: that action, that performance, that plan, that attack, that killing, that destruction, that intentional taking away of life of a living being, this is called killing living beings.

original: prāṇātipātī khalv ihaiko bhavati /

translated: One here is a killer of living beings, means one who is not separated from killing living beings.

analyzed: kataraḥ prayogaḥ parīttasya maitrasya cetaḥ samādheḥ
translated: What is the practice of the limited loving-kindness concentration of the mind?

original: kathaṃ prayuktaś ca punaḥ parīttaṃ maitraṃ cetaḥsamādhiṃ saṃāpadyate / āha /
analyzed: katham prayuktaḥ ca punar parīttam maitram cetaḥ samādhim saṃāpadyate  āha
translated: And how does one practice to attain the limited loving-kindness concentration of the mind? It is said:

analyzed: yathā khalu iha ekatyasya ye satvāḥ bhavanti iṣṭāḥ kāntāḥ

analyzed: tat yathā mātā vā pitā vā bhrātā vā bhaginī vā anyatama anyatamaḥ vā mitra jñāti sālohitaḥ vā  ebhiḥ parīttaiḥ satvaiḥ parīttam maitrī sahabhuvam cittam āsthāpayati upasthāpayati damayati
translated: such as a mother, father, brother, sister, or any other friend, relative, or kinsman.🔽With these limited beings, one establishes, upholds, tames,

analyzed: śamayatu vyupaśamayati ekotīkurute samādadhāti

analyzed: tasya ebhiḥ parīttaiḥ satvaiḥ parīttam maitrī sahabhuvam cittam āsthāpayataḥ saṃsthāpayataḥ upasthāpayataḥ damayataḥ śamayataḥ vyupaśamayataḥ
translated: For him, when he establishes, settles, places, tames, calms, thoroughly calms,

analyzed: ekotīkurvataḥ samādadhataḥ tat cittam vikṣipyati visarati vidhāvati na ekotībhavati na ekāgrā smṛtiḥ saṃtiṣṭhate

original: parīttaṃ sukhitā bata satvā iti yad asya tac cittaṃ vikṣipyati visarati vidhāvati DhskD
analyzed: parīttam sukhitāḥ bata satvāḥ iti yat asya tat cittam vikṣipyati visarati vidhāvati

translated: it does not become unified, and mindfulness does not remain one-pointed.

translated: This is what should be said.🔽When that mind of his is distracted, scattered, and wanders, he gathers it back to that very object.

original: tad eva nimittaṃ manasikurute /
analyzed: tat eva nimittam manasikurute
translated: He attends to that very sign.

original: parīttaṃ sukhitā bata satvā iti evaṃ manasikurvato yad vīryaṃ yo vyāyāmo niṣkramaḥ parākramaḥ sthāma āraṃbha utsāha utsūdhir apratiśrabdhi DhskD
analyzed: parīttam sukhitāḥ bata satvāḥ iti evam manasikurvataḥ yat vīryam yaḥ vyāyāmaḥ niṣkramaḥ parākramaḥ sthāmaḥ āraṃbhaḥ utsāhaḥ utsūdhiḥ apratiśrabdhi
translated: Having the thought May they be happy! while contemplating a limited [object], whatever effort, exertion, departure, valor, strength, undertaking, enthusiasm, resoluteness, and indefatigability there is,

original: tad yaḥ ayaṃ prayogaḥ parīttasya maitrasya cetaḥsamādheḥ evaṃ prayuktaś ca punaḥ parīttaṃ maitraṃ cetaḥsamādhiṃ samāpadyate /

translated: that is the application of this limited friendliness meditation. Thus applied, he enters the limited friendliness meditation.

original: sa tam utpannaṃ mārgam āsevayati bhāvayati bahulīkurute tasya imaṃ mārgam DhskD
analyzed: sa tam utpannam mārgam āsevayati bhāvayati bahulīkurute tasya imam mārgam dhskd
translated: He cultivates, develops, and repeats that arisen path. For him, this path

translated: And when that mind is abiding, resting, and focused, being non-dual and not deficient, he thinks May they be happy! with limited friendliness.

original: etāvat parīttaṃ maitraṃ cetaḥsamādhiṃ samāpanna /
analyzed: etāvat parīttam maitram cetaḥ samādhim samāpanna
translated: Having entered the limited friendliness meditation to this extent,

original: iti vaktavyaṃ /
analyzed: iti vaktavyam
translated: this should be said.

analyzed: tathā samāpannasya yat cittam manaḥ vijñānam idam ucyate parīttam maitrī sahabhuvam
translated: For one who has thus attained, the mind, the mental consciousness, is said to be limited, co-existent with loving-kindness.

original: citte yā cetanā vistareṇa yāvad /
analyzed: citte yā cetanā vistareṇa yāvat
translated: The volition in the mind, and so on in detail.

original: te sarva ime dharmāḥ parīttaṃ maitraṃ cetaḥsamādhir iti vaktavyāḥ /🔽kataraḥ prayogo 'pramāṇasya maitrasya cetaḥsamādheḥ /
analyzed: te sarve ime dharmāḥ parīttam maitram cetaḥ samādhiḥ iti vaktavyāḥ  kataraḥ pramāṇasya maitrasya cetaḥ samādheḥ
translated: All these dharmas should be said to be limited loving-kindness, the concentration of mind.🔽What is the practice of the immeasurable concentration of loving-kindness?

original: yad evābhyaste parītte DhskD
analyzed: yat eva abhyaste parītte
translated: Just that which is cultivated in the limited concentration of loving-kindness.

original: maitre cetaḥsamādhau taṃ cittaṃ damayitvā kārayitvāsvedayitvā parisvedayitvā ṛjukṛtvā mṛdu karmaṇīyaṃ ārjjavam āśravaṃ vidheyaṃ /🔽tataḥ paścād apramāṇaṃ sukhitā bata satvā iti śanaiḥ spharati pūrvāṃ dakṣiṇāṃ DhskD

translated: Having subdued that mind, made it work, heated it, thoroughly heated it, straightened it, made it pliant, workable, flexible, and obedient in the concentration of loving-kindness,🔽then afterwards he slowly expands: 'May beings in the east be happy.' 'May beings in the south be happy.'🔽'May beings in the west be happy.' 'May beings in the north be happy.'

analyzed: smṛtiḥ saṃtiṣṭhate

analyzed: tāvatā apramāṇam maitrī cetaḥ samādhiḥ samāpannaḥ iti vaktavyam  sa tat cittam vikṣipyantam
